* Medication administration utilizing the newest advancements in documentation technologies designed to ensure the safest delivery of medications to our residents.
* Multi-disciplinary discharging of residents for short stays or to permanent placement to ensure safe transitioning and continuum of care.

North Star Academy currently manages fourteen schools in Newark, NJ serving students in grades K through 12. North Star Academy is NJ's #1 highest performing public charter school and has served Newark families for over 20 years.

 **Job Description**  

Uncommon Middle School Science teachers work in grade-level teams to prepare all students with the tools and knowledge to critically engage in the field of science. At the heart of all Science courses is a love for the subject and inquiry-based learning, including a robust focus on student discourse and the science practices. Science teachers employ a variety of instructional strategies to develop a passion for scientific questioning and analysis in their students. Our teachers strive for subject mastery and have a keen sense of the socio-emotional changes middle schoolers experience. At the conclusion of eighth grade, students are prepared for the academic autonomy and college preparatory focus of our high schools.

title: Business Intelligence Director - CVS Media Exchange (CMX)
description:
Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.  

  

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.


Our Customer Success and Growth Organization is at the heart of our member, patient, and customer experiences as we have a unique focus on defining meaningful moments for those we serve. Our north star is creating heartfelt, personalized moments by listening to feedback to remove existing obstacles and simplify enterprise experiences. You are joining a team that cares for the well-being of our colleagues by working together in a supportive, collaborative and agile environment.

**Position Summary**


CVS Media Exchange is hiring a Business Intelligence – Lead Director who will report to the Executive Director, Business Intelligence.


CVS Media Exchange [CMX] is dedicated to driving measurable outcomes for our suppliers, merchants, stores, GMs, brand advertisers, and agencies. Our full-funnel ad solutions leverage CVS’s in-store and online data, extensive reach, and to provide measurable results for our clientele. With a range of flexible pricing and buying models, including self-service; these solutions help businesses build brand awareness, engage with CVS consumers, and convert CVS consumers to shoppers.


As a Lead Director, Business Intelligence, you will function as product owner and help build best-in-class omni-channel measurement products and platforms that deliver digital advertising campaign measurement at scale. The Lead Director, Business Intelligence position will play a lead role in building platforms that measure the effectiveness of ad-campaigns in driving customer awareness, product consideration and omni-channel conversion, ROAS, and incrementality. They will work in unison with engineers, UX designers, data scientists and business partners to deliver a client-facing product.


The Lead Director, Business Intelligence will build and manage the measurement roadmap, align business and technical needs, and be the “voice of the product” with stakeholders to ensure that their needs are met. The Lead Director, Business Intelligence will drive the end-to-end product lifecycle from requirement definitions, research, metrics analysis, technical specifications, development, testing, KPIs and launch efforts to commercialize product innovation and drive increased advertiser investment. The Lead Director, Business Intelligence will run product discovery to collect customer feedback and collect relevant data points to articulate business value and help prioritize future product roadmap.


The Lead Director, Business Intelligence will encourage the open exchange of information and viewpoints, as well as inspire others to achieve challenging goals and high standards of performance while committing to the organization's direction. You will foster sense of urgency to achieve goals and leverage resources to overcome unexpected obstacles.


Additional responsibilities of the Business Intelligence – Lead Director include:

* Strategic Leadership: Define product vision, strategy, and development of suite of ad measurement products.
* Product Leadership: Utilize your product knowledge, customer feedback, and relevant data to assess value, build business cases, and prioritize effectively. Lead product discovery and maintain a roadmap and backlog focused on high-impact work for advertisers, merchants and stakeholders.
* Product Roadmap: Manage product roadmaps, align business and technical needs, analyze customer and product data, turn customer insights into actionable initiatives, determine rollout strategy, and manage risks. maintain and refine the product backlog (create user stories & acceptance criteria) while prioritizing the backlog to focus on the highest impact.
* Team Management: Lead a team of Data Scientists, Data Engineers and business analysts to deliver the Measurement roadmap, establish data analytics best practices, manage and mentor team members, drive Cross-Functional alignment, and resolve key blockers.
* Collaborative Innovation: Build strong relationships with key partners by driving priorities aligned to business goals, communicating and prioritizing product roadmaps, and gaining buy-in from executive leadership. Partner with Data Science, Engineering, and other CVS partners to define data requirements, measurement methodologies, APIs and UX for reporting dashboards.
* Performance Excellence: Define and track key metrics to measure the success of our Measurement product, ensuring we continuously improve and innovate. Execute the product strategy and roadmap to achieve key business objectives (OKRs).
* Data Transformation Layer Management: Oversee the data transformation processes, ensuring efficient and accurate transformation, enrichment, and normalization of data for reporting.
* Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate with engineering, analytics, insights, and media teams to align data strategies and ensure seamless integration with ad-serving platforms.
* Data as a Service (DaaS): Develop strategies to offer data as a service to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring flexible and scalable access to high-quality data sets.
* Data Foundation Development: Support design and implementation of scalable and robust data infrastructure that supports real-time & batch data processing and analytics.
* Data Quality and Governance: Work with Engineering to establish and enforce data quality frameworks and governance policies to ensure data integrity and reliability.
* Industry Expertise: Partner with Product Marketing to conduct industry and competitive analyses to deeply understand emerging trends in advertising measurement to inform product roadmap.


This is a hybrid position (3 days in the office, Tuesday - Thursday) at one of our hubs (NYC, Boston or Chicago).

 **Required Qualifications**

* 8+ years of hands-on experience in Product Management (majority in advertising technology or advertising measurement strongly preferred). Proven ability to lead and influence, with a track record of success in building and executing product strategies. Sound business judgment and ability to think strategically, analyze quantitatively, problem-solve, scope technical requirements, and make difficult trade-off decisions.
* 4+ years of leadership experience in BI/data analytics/data science/insights
* 3+ years of experience managing product managers, data scientists and engineers.
* 5+ years’ experience in designing business intelligence solutions (dashboard development) through use of data visualization software required (Tableau preferred) to uncover trends, realize insights, explore sources, and tell stories.
* 4+ years’ Experience in data management and working on hybrid infrastructure of Cloud and On-prem. GCP Preferred. Strong analytical skills with a solid foundation in programming (e.g., SQL, Python), database environment (e.g., big-data platforms, SQL)

 **Preferred Qualifications**

* Industry Experience: Deep understanding of the digital advertising ecosystem, Digital Ad Tech Stack, Retail Media Advertising and the underlying technologies.
* Digital Media Measurement: Deep understanding of ad measurement solutions, including MMMs, MTAs, and Brand Lift (and other upper funnel measurement)
* Customer-first mindset: Strong interpersonal skills; as well as strong initiative and self-motivation and the ability to work both independently and manage teams within a customer-service oriented environment.
* Excellent Organizational skills: to handle several projects simultaneously, accommodate shifting priorities, and meet deadlines. Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment. Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources.
* Communication Skills: Exceptional storytelling and presentation abilities, with a knack for influencing stakeholders and driving consensus.
* Agile development: Test and learn mentality and an agile way of working to improve your product

 **Education**


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative /technical field (e.g., engineering, computer science, data science, mathematics) or equivalent (HS Diploma + 4 years of relevant experience) required


MBA or Masters degree in a quantitative /technical field (e.g., engineering, computer science, data science, mathematics or equivalent) preferred

**Pay Range**


The typical pay range for this role is:


$100,000.00 - $231,540.00

The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors.
